macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US500 Index Rises to 6920 Points on January 6, Up 0.26%
items.summary: The US500 gained 0.26% to reach 6920 points on January 6, following a 0.36% increase to 6883 on January 5. Year-to-date, the index is up significantly with monthly gains of 0.54% and 15.19% annually.

items.title: Dow Jones Closes 0.54% Higher at 48322 on January 5
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 258 points or 0.54% to close at 48322, led by gains in Boeing (4.91%), Caterpillar (4.34%), and Goldman Sachs (3.92%). Losses were seen in Salesforce (-4.25%), Microsoft (-2.28%), and Amazon (-1.89%).

items.title: Explosive Start to 2026 with Everything Rally Led by Dow Jones
items.summary: US indexes opened the year higher with Dow Jones leading amid broad asset rallies; commodities like silver and platinum surged +6%, while USD weakened. Energy, finance, and defensives dominated stock performance on January 5.

items.title: US100 Climbs 0.61% to 25359 as Risk Currencies Rise
items.summary: The US100 index rose 0.61% to 25359, with VIX up 0.63% to 15.14; risk-centric currencies gained against weakening USD and CAD. Traders eye upcoming NFP, PMIs, and Fed speeches for rate cut signals.

items.title: USD Index Ends 0.2% Lower Amid Dovish Data Expectations
items.summary: The USD index (DXY) hit 98.9 but closed 0.2% down, facing modest downside bias ahead of key labor data. Euro-centric inflation releases and US PMIs loom as market movers.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Raw response
items.summary: title":"Bitcoin Extends Rally Approaching $94,500 Resistance","summary":"Bitcoin has rallied for a fifth consecutive day, nearing the $94,500 resistance level amid recovering market sentiment and rebounding derivatives activity. Bitcoin's market dominance dipped below 59%, indicating altcoin recovery, with strong bullish bets on $100,000 call options for late January expiry.","source":"KuCoin","url":"https://www.kucoin.com/news/articles/crypto-daily-market-report-january-6-2026"},{"title":"Bitco

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils Rubin Platform with Six New AI Chips for Next-Generation Computing
items.summary: NVIDIA launched the Rubin platform featuring six new chips designed to deliver mixture-of-experts model inference at up to 10x lower cost per token compared to Blackwell, while training MoE models with 4x fewer GPUs. Major AI labs including OpenAI, Meta, Anthropic, and others are adopting the platform.

items.title: NVIDIA Introduces Physical AI Systems for Real-World Autonomous Applications at CES 2026
items.summary: NVIDIA unveiled new AI models and systems focused on reasoning and decision-making for autonomous vehicles, robots, and industrial machines. The systems address the 'long tail' of rare scenarios through step-by-step reasoning rather than pattern matching alone.

items.title: Hyundai Motor Group Announces AI Robotics Strategy with Boston Dynamics Partnership
items.summary: Hyundai Motor Group unveiled its AI Robotics Strategy at CES 2026, partnering with Boston Dynamics to advance human-robot collaboration. The initiative includes developing an end-to-end AI robotics value chain and establishing a Physical AI Application Center.

items.title: U.S. Army Establishes New AI/ML Officer Career Path (49B)
items.summary: The U.S. Army formally designated the 49B AI/ML Officer as an official area of concentration, with first officer selections beginning January 2026. Officers will receive graduate-level training to operationalize AI capabilities across military operations.

items.title: Samsung Emphasizes Trust, Security, and Privacy in AI at CES 2026
items.summary: Samsung highlighted the importance of trust-by-design in AI systems, emphasizing transparency, predictability, and user control. The company partnered with Google and Microsoft to strengthen shared security research and ecosystem-wide protection.

items.title: MBZUAI and AWS Launch Multi-Year AI Research Collaboration
items.summary: MBZUAI and AWS announced a multi-year collaboration linking AI research with skills development and startup growth, connecting academia with applied AI development.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: DuneCrawl Launches on PC as Co-op Desert Pirate Adventure
items.summary: DuneCrawl released today on PC, an online co-op action-adventure game where players act as desert pirates. It marks one of the first notable game releases of 2026.[5]

items.title: Intel Unveils Core Ultra Series 3 Processors at CES 2026
items.summary: Intel announced the Core Ultra Series 3, the first AI PC platform on 18A process tech, promising superior AI performance, graphics, and efficiency for gaming laptops. Pre-orders start January 6, with systems available from January 27.[4]

items.title: January 2026 Game Releases Previewed: StarRupture and Arknights: Endfield Highlighted
items.summary: Anticipated January releases include StarRupture, a PS5 title focused on building industrial complexes amid threats, and Arknights: Endfield. Multiple outlets list top games kicking off the year strongly.[1][2]

items.title: 2026 Gaming Outlook: GTA 6 and Record Game Releases Predicted
items.summary: Analysts forecast 2026 as a historic year for gaming with GTA 6 and unprecedented game volume, alongside trends like AI debates and niche high-quality titles. Coverage includes industry previews and weekly news roundups.[3]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Hyundai and Boston Dynamics Unveil Humanoid Robot Atlas at CES
items.summary: Hyundai-owned Boston Dynamics publicly demonstrated its humanoid robot Atlas for the first time at CES, with a production version set for deployment by 2028 at Hyundai's EV plant in Georgia. The event also featured Spot robots dancing and a new partnership with Google's DeepMind for robot technology.

items.title: CES 2026 Opens with Previews of Robotic Dogs, Smart Pet Dryers, and UV-C Vacuums
items.summary: Ahead of CES 2026 opening on Jan. 6, journalists previewed products like robotic dogs, smart pet dryers, UV-C germ-eliminating vacuums, and the Body Scan 2 longevity station. Major brands including Bosch, LG, Sony, and Hyundai held press conferences introducing new technologies.

items.title: Samsung Hosts Tech Forum on Open Ecosystems for Smart Homes at CES 2026
items.summary: Samsung convened industry leaders at CES 2026 to discuss smart home interoperability, highlighting its SmartThings ecosystem with over 500 million users and partnerships enabling seamless connected home experiences.

items.title: AMD CEO Lisa Su Delivers CES 2026 Keynote on Future Solutions
items.summary: AMD's Dr. Lisa Su presented the opening CES 2026 keynote, focusing on visions for solutions from cloud to devices, with speculation around Gorgon Point laptop processors and new X3D desktop processors.

items.title: NFT Paris and RWA Paris Canceled, First Major Web3 Events Shelved in 2026
items.summary: After four successful editions, NFT Paris and RWA Paris have been officially canceled for 2026, marking the first major Web3 event cancellations amid the ongoing crypto winter.
